description: Restores a cluster to an arbitrary point in time. Users can restore to any point in time before LatestRestorableTime for up to BackupRetentionPeriod days. The target cluster is created from the source cluster with the same configuration as the original cluster, except that the new cluster is created with the default security group.

parameters.name: DBClusterIdentifier
parameters.description: The name of the new cluster to be created. Constraints: Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens. The first character must be a letter. Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

parameters.name: RestoreType
parameters.description: The type of restore to be performed. You can specify one of the following values: full-copy - The new DB cluster is restored as a full copy of the source DB cluster. copy-on-write - The new DB cluster is restored as a clone of the source DB cluster. Constraints: You can't specify copy-on-write if the engine version of the source DB cluster is earlier than 1.11. If you don't specify a RestoreType value, then the new DB cluster is restored as a full copy of the source DB cluster.

parameters.name: SourceDBClusterIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the source cluster from which to restore. Constraints: Must match the identifier of an existing DBCluster.

parameters.name: RestoreToTime
parameters.description: The date and time to restore the cluster to. Valid values: A time in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) format. Constraints: Must be before the latest restorable time for the instance. Must be specified if the UseLatestRestorableTime parameter is not provided. Cannot be specified if the UseLatestRestorableTime parameter is true. Cannot be specified if the RestoreType parameter is copy-on-write. Example: 2015-03-07T23:45:00Z.

parameters.name: UseLatestRestorableTime
parameters.description: A value that is set to true to restore the cluster to the latest restorable backup time, and false otherwise. Default: false Constraints: Cannot be specified if the RestoreToTime parameter is provided.

parameters.name: Port
parameters.description: The port number on which the new cluster accepts connections. Constraints: Must be a value from 1150 to 65535. Default: The default port for the engine.

parameters.name: DBSubnetGroupName
parameters.description: The subnet group name to use for the new cluster. Constraints: If provided, must match the name of an existing DBSubnetGroup. Example: mySubnetgroup.

parameters.name: VpcSecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: A list of VPC security groups that the new cluster belongs to. (string) ---

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to be assigned to the restored cluster. (dict) --- Metadata assigned to an Amazon DocumentDB resource consisting of a key-value pair. Key (string) --- The required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with ' aws:' or ' rds:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$'). Value (string) --- The optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with ' aws:' or ' rds:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with ' aws:' or ' rds:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with ' aws:' or ' rds:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

parameters.name: KmsKeyId
parameters.description: The KMS key identifier to use when restoring an encrypted cluster from an encrypted cluster. The KMS key identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the KMS encryption key. If you are restoring a cluster with the same Amazon Web Services account that owns the KMS encryption key used to encrypt the new cluster, then you can use the KMS key alias instead of the ARN for the KMS encryption key. You can restore to a new cluster and encrypt the new cluster with an KMS key that is different from the KMS key used to encrypt the source cluster. The new DB cluster is encrypted with the KMS key identified by the KmsKeyId parameter. If you do not specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then the following occurs: If the cluster is encrypted, then the restored cluster is encrypted using the KMS key that was used to encrypt the source cluster. If the cluster is not encrypted, then the restored cluster is not encrypted. If DBClusterIdentifier refers to a cluster that is not encrypted, then the restore request is rejected.

parameters.name: EnableCloudwatchLogsExports
parameters.description: A list of log types that must be enabled for exporting to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. (string) ---

parameters.name: StorageType
parameters.description: The storage type to associate with the DB cluster. For information on storage types for Amazon DocumentDB clusters, see Cluster storage configurations in the Amazon DocumentDB Developer Guide. Valid values for storage type - standard | iopt1 Default value is standard.

nested_items.name: DBCluster
nested_items.description: Detailed information about a cluster.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: Provides the list of Amazon EC2 Availability Zones that instances in the cluster can be created in.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of days for which automatic snapshots are retained.

nested_items.name: DBClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: Contains a user-supplied cluster identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies a cluster.

nested_items.name: DBClusterParameterGroup
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the cluster parameter group for the cluster.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroup
nested_items.description: Specifies information on the subnet group that is associated with the cluster, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Specifies the current state of this cluster.

nested_items.name: PercentProgress
nested_items.description: Specifies the progress of the operation as a percentage.

nested_items.name: EarliestRestorableTime
nested_items.description: The earliest time to which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.

nested_items.name: Endpoint
nested_items.description: Specifies the connection endpoint for the primary instance of the cluster.

nested_items.name: ReaderEndpoint
nested_items.description: The reader endpoint for the cluster. The reader endpoint for a cluster load balances connections across the Amazon DocumentDB replicas that are available in a cluster. As clients request new connections to the reader endpoint, Amazon DocumentDB distributes the connection requests among the Amazon DocumentDB replicas in the cluster. This functionality can help balance your read workload across multiple Amazon DocumentDB replicas in your cluster.

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the cluster has instances in multiple Availability Zones.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: Provides the name of the database engine to be used for this cluster.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: Indicates the database engine version.

nested_items.name: LatestRestorableTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: MasterUsername
nested_items.description: Contains the master user name for the cluster.

nested_items.name: PreferredBackupWindow
nested_items.description: Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the BackupRetentionPeriod.

nested_items.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: ReplicationSourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: Contains the identifier of the source cluster if this cluster is a secondary cluster.

nested_items.name: ReadReplicaIdentifiers
nested_items.description: Contains one or more identifiers of the secondary clusters that are associated with this cluster.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DBClusterMembers
nested_items.description: Provides the list of instances that make up the cluster.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the instance identifier for this member of the cluster.

nested_items.name: IsClusterWriter
nested_items.description: A value that is true if the cluster member is the primary instance for the cluster and false otherwise.

nested_items.name: DBClusterParameterGroupStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies the status of the cluster parameter group for this member of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: PromotionTier
nested_items.description: A value that specifies the order in which an Amazon DocumentDB replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: Provides a list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups that the cluster belongs to.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroupId
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: HostedZoneId
nested_items.description: Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted zone.

nested_items.name: StorageEncrypted
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the cluster is encrypted.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: If StorageEncrypted is true, the KMS key identifier for the encrypted cluster.

nested_items.name: DbClusterResourceId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region-unique, immutable identifier for the cluster. This identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for the cluster is accessed.

nested_items.name: DBClusterArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster.

nested_items.name: AssociatedRoles
nested_items.description: Provides a list of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that are associated with the cluster. (IAM) roles that are associated with a cluster grant permission for the cluster to access other Amazon Web Services services on your behalf.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAMrole that is associated with the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Describes the state of association between the IAMrole and the cluster. The Status property returns one of the following values:
ACTIVE - The IAMrole ARN is associated with the cluster and can be used to access other Amazon Web Services services on your behalf.
PENDING - The IAMrole ARN is being associated with the cluster.
INVALID - The IAMrole ARN is associated with the cluster, but the cluster cannot assume the IAMrole to access other Amazon Web Services services on your behalf.

nested_items.name: CloneGroupId
nested_items.description: Identifies the clone group to which the DB cluster is associated.

nested_items.name: ClusterCreateTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the time when the cluster was created, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: EnabledCloudwatchLogsExports
nested_items.description: A list of log types that this cluster is configured to export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DeletionProtection
nested_items.description: Specifies whether this cluster can be deleted. If DeletionProtection is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted unless it is modified and DeletionProtection is disabled. DeletionProtection protects clusters from being accidentally deleted.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: Storage type associated with your cluster.

nested_items.name: MasterUserSecret
nested_items.description: The secret managed by Amazon DocumentDB in Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager for the master user password.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret.

nested_items.name: SecretStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the secret.
creating - The secret is being created.
active - The secret is available for normal use and rotation.
rotating - The secret is being rotated.

impaired - The secret can be used to access database credentials, but it can't be rotated. A secret might have this status if, for example, permissions are changed so that Amazon DocumentDB can no longer access either the secret or the KMS key for the secret. When a secret has this status, you can correct the condition that caused the status. Alternatively, modify the instance to turn off automatic management of database credentials, and then modify the instance again to turn on automatic management of database credentials.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the secret.
